quoteFirst: At twelve past two he made the Alert signal to come within hail; half-past two he made the Royal Oak's signal to take the ship in tow that had struck her colours. At twenty-two past two the Admiral made the Resolution signal to tack, and we discontinued engaging. At
quoteLast: some of our ships upon our larboard beam began firing, as did the rest of the ships as they came up with the enemy. At three quarters past three the Admiral made the Repulse and Alcides signal to bear down.
title: Memoirs and Correspondence of Admiral Lord de Saumarez. Vol II
author: Ross, John, Sir, 1777-1856

title: The Fight for Constantinople: A Story of the Gallipoli Peninsula
author: Westerman, Percy F. (Percy Francis), 1876-1959; Wigfull, W. Edward (William Edward), 1875-1944 [Illustrator]
